body_html:
One more thing considering creation of bottlenecks.

If a new version of retrain.py is run in a bottleneck directory, that contains bottlenecks files created with a previous version of retrain.py then retrain.py will crash (it will try to read list of floats from .txt file and fail).

To prevent this problem we can either:

  • delete all bottlenecks created with a previous version of retrain.py (it is remove .txt files from bottleneck dir)
  • or modify get_bottleneck_path function, so it appends not ".txt", but ".bin" postfix.

Which one is better option?

To prevent this problem we can either:

delete all bottlenecks created with a previous version of retrain.py (it is remove .txt files from bottleneck dir)
or modify get_bottleneck_path function, so it appends not ".txt", but ".bin" postfix.

Which one is better option?
body:
One more thing considering creation of bottlenecks. 

If a new version of retrain.py is run in a bottleneck directory, that contains bottlenecks files created with a previous version of retrain.py then retrain.py will crash (it will try to read list of floats from .txt file and fail). 

To prevent this problem we can either:
- delete all bottlenecks created with a previous version of retrain.py (it is remove .txt files from bottleneck dir)
- or modify get_bottleneck_path function, so it appends not ".txt", but ".bin" postfix.

Which one is better option?
